name: Hotel das Cataratas by Orient-Express

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Would highly recommend this hotel as it is within the National Parque allowing quick and easy entry to the Falls, it offers the best location on the Brazilian side. It is a high quality hotel, though our room was small and simple with a puny bathroom. Leafy pleasant grounds, a charming pool area and good breakfast. The hotel does have a somewhat austere feel though, the smart restaurant and the bar are particularly sterile and souless. Great service throughout. The big let down was the food. Both the buffet and the a la carte options were average at best. The macuco boat trip on the Falls is fabulous, as is the helicopter trip, both organised by Iguazu Experiences who operate within the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location for the Falls
Fabulous hotel
reviews.text: The only place to stay if you are going to Iguazu.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic staff and a real sanctuary away from the crowds. Really amazing to be able to visit the falls before everyone else arrives.
reviews.title: Breathtaking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was incredible and we enjoyed the buffet supper very much.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Best place to view the falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not stay anywhere else if you can afford it !
reviews.title: Amazing location, poor & extortionately expensive food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, extremely helpful staff. Right across the road from the falls. Be sure to walk the falls trail before the tour busses are able to enter the park. Check out the sunset from the bell tower. Amazing!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night here – should be a minimum stay of two nights to get the best out of its ambience and location right next to the falls on the Brazilian side. It was absolutely brilliant!
reviews.title: Ambience with unique location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel well located close enough to everything with the free bus in the park very nice feeling and very helpful staff food a bit expensive but the service makes up for it
reviews.title: View looking the falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel's location is undeniably perfect - right opposite the falls on the Brazilian side where the views are most beautiful. The rooms were lovely, the service impecable in all respects and the food was really very very good. When we arrived our room was not yet ready (we were early) so we went and ate lunch by the beautiful pool - they had a typical Brazilian buffet / grill lunch, which was excellent. When our room was ready the receptionist actually came to find us and bring us our key and take us on a tour. Our room was very big and well appointed with lots of lovely toiletries and some more free Havaianas! The pool was beautiful with plenty of loungers and the bar by the pool served great drinks and food. Breakfast was wonderful - very high quality and massive choice (they even did porridge which made me feel very at home!). The gym was almost empty and had great machines and weights - all very new. We also ate in the a la carte menu one night as well, which was excellent food - true haute cuisine. The real advantage is the fact that after the park closes you can wander down to the falls and watch the sunset in realtive peace. A great hotel and a beautiful place.
reviews.title: Large hotel that feels small (which is a very good thing!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel to celebrate a special birthday and our first time to South America. We were told by friends that this hotel was a must for it's privileged location inside the National Park. You certainly pay the price for such privilege but we realised very quickly that it was worth every cent we paid. On our first morning we walked down to the falls just as the sun was rising. I don't think we will ever have again such an experience of sheer beauty and magic. The falls were framed by a complete rainbow that did not look real it was so perfect. We were alone in this unbelievable landscape and it was hard to believe we weren't dreaming. Back at the hotel, the service was outstanding, perfect attention to every detail. The breakfasts are so generous and beautifully prepared with the best fruit platters, fresh exotic juices, gorgeous pastries, enough to set you off for the day on many adventures. Apart from all the obvious attractions this place has to offer, we particularly enjoyed the bird park on the brazilian side that has the most extraordinary variety of parrots, toucans, butterflies and other exotic birds you would be lucky to spot in the wild otherwise. We spend three nights in this hotel, broke the bank, but would absolutely recommend it. It is a once in a lifetime experience.
reviews.title: The best hotel in the most amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our second time here and the stay was really very good - nice rooms and just about the best service from all staff that you could wish for. The rooms are a nice size and very comfortable. They're certainly not cheap but you get quality and ... the best location to see the Falls, as so many have already said, it's just fabulous.
reviews.title: Excellent service - a niggle or two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: The niggles are to do with eating. There are two restaurants but on two of our three nights, one (Ipe) was closed for travel groups. Now, I don't want to sit amongst 100+ people in the same group, but if you stay at this hotel you don't have much of an option but to eat there, so closing a restaurant is a bit naff, frankly. Plus the one left open (Itaipu) is pretty expensive.
reviews.title: Spectacular location, beautiful hotel with outstanding service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And we were told that the bar served food at lunchtime - only to discover on our last day that the bar was closed at lunchtime!
reviews.title: Near Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But they are just that - niggles. It's still a great hotel and the best place, surely, to experience the truly wonderful place that is Iguacu National Park. Bucket-list material.
reviews.title: The only place to stay to really experience the falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a long weekend away with my partner as a birthday present. It seemed a little expensive at the time of booking, but once we arrived we realized we made a great choice! Being the only hotel inside the National Park on the Brailisian side and directly in front of the Iguaçu Falls, meant we were able to take scenic walks in the early morning or late afternoon without hoards of tourists. The service offered was impeccable! All staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room was spacious, comfortable and full of old world charm. From the moment we arrived we knew we were going to have a very special experience! I thoroughly recommend this hotel for special occasions... You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: An unforgettable experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night before moving to the Sheraton on the Argentine side for one additional night. Both hotels are the sole properties located in their respective national parks so there are no other choices if you wish to stay within the parks and have easy access to the falls. You are therefore a captive audience! Although das Cataratas is a beautiful property on the whole and the rooms are attractive, its management is milking its location for all it's worth. Our travel agent reserved a standard room and we were therefore not expecting a view of the falls from our window. We learned, however, that most other available "views" are basically worthless. The first room we were shown was on the lower level of the "garden wing" and had a view of the hotel's service entrance. The second room, also in the garden wing, had a "view" of a high mound of grass. The third room (which we ultimately accepted, because "nothing else was available") had a view of the roadway adjoining the property. The garden wing is quite a long walk from the lobby and restaurant and is not really desirable. Perhaps other "views" are available from this wing, but we certainly saw a representative selection. Management is not friendly; in fact, we felt as if we were on the defensive when we requested a better view. Our room was also not ready for occupancy when we arrived at 2 PM, which was supposed to be the official check-in time. The hotel does have a beautiful swimming pool and we thought the dinner buffet was quite good and not too expensive, considering its quality. I would still recommend staying 1 night on each side of the falls, but be prepared for an "attitude" at this hotel. The Sheraton, although not as luxurious, is much friendlier and welcoming and most of the rooms have a straight-on view of the falls.
reviews.title: Taking Advantage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing hotel with great service. Food is fairly priced for a 5 star hotel and the location probably doesnt get any better, no matter hwere you are in the World
reviews.title: Das Cataratas Iguazu

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Full review at http://www.weroamaround.com
reviews.title: really worth the extra money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: went there with a 10 yr old child in April. The rooms are well kept and mixing high tech with very traditional furniture etc. Pool area great.Location is truly unique. Excellent staff. Only negative point is, like all restaurants in Brazil thanks to taxes, the wine is expensive.
reviews.title: Worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: went to the Sheraton on the Argentinian side - very 1980s efficient but no soul, not remotely comparable..
reviews.title: An amazing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night 2nd April. On arrival we were immediately greeted by Check In Staff, Patrick. Patrick Chan. He was simply amazing! Patrick upgraded us to a nice larger room. He told us all about the various amenities within the hotel. Our room wasn't quite ready yet, and Patrick then proceeded to take us on a walk around of the hotel. We decided to ask him to help us with a web check in for our flight the next day. No problem. He took us to the Business Center and even though there was a slight problem with the system, he diligently proceeded to make sure everything was ok. Because of the delay in our room being ready, Patrick called the restaurant by the pool and complemented two drinks on the house. It was a hot sunny day and two superb Caipirinhas were just the drinks we needed. It was a very nice gesture that really made my wife and I feel very appreciated.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel Superb Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was superb. Newly renovated. Clean. Rooms, spacious. Pool lovely. There was a Brazilian BBQ that night and that was simply a fantastic feast. Servers superb. The next morning breakfast was at the same pool side restaurant. Again, a wonderful buffet that had everything you could imagine.
reviews.title: Best Location, Great Ambiance, Tiny Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was right at the Falls. You could easily walk to all the Trails if you so desired. There was a Hop On Hop Off Bus that stopped down the hill from the front of the hotel. That bus could take you to the various parts of the Park system. It was very nice as at 5pm the Park would close to the public, and you had the entire park to yourself as a guest of the hotel. Again in the morning the Park would open at 9am to the public. My wife and I hit the trails after breakfast around 8am and leisurely were able to go to the finest vantage point over looking the vast expanse of the Falls system and have NO ONE around us. Superb.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is truly a gem. A very peaceful setting over looking the Falls system. The hotel, and members of the staff like Patrick, were all simply outstanding and definitely would make for a return visit. In a word, Excellent.
reviews.title: PERFECT!!!! - The Best Hotel I Have Ever Visited.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Location, Location, Location. The most compelling reason to stay here. It is IN the park with exclusive access before and after the rest of the tourists swarm. Very nice grounds and public areas. Food was adequate if a bit overpriced. Room was downright cramped. Also visited the very dated Sheraton on the other side and much preferred our property. The falls were spectacular!
reviews.title: Place to Stay in the National Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Issue 1 - room: we were paying around 400 USD / night for a superior room, given that we were in the middle of a vast forest I was shocked to be taken to a (no joke) 15m2 floor space room at the back of the hotel with a view of a water processing plant which made a very loud noise all the time with workman talking outside it and trucks coming and going. I have stayed in many 5 star locations in downtown Hong Kong and New York with twice as much floor space as this. We also got the occasional smell of chicken being badly fried (see food comment below). The fittings were nice and the bed comfortable but basics such as the shower were poor. No water pressure at all (strange being next to a water fall!) and impossible to set the temperature, either scolding hot or freezing cold. After complaining we were offered a different room which was much larger and quieter on the second day but as we were already unpacked we decided to take the discount offered instead. Our room wasn't cleaned by 3pm on two of the days and I had to call twice to have it done not what you want when you come back from excursions.
reviews.title: Wow, great location and hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Issue 2 food - understandably in such a remote location food will be more expensive. But 150 USD for a room service two course dinner with no alcohol? Ok fine, charge this but make sure it is fresh, delicious and organised by a room service manager who has a basic grasp of English. I'm not exaggerating when I say that unless you order EXACTLY what is on the menu (takeaway numbers style) you will have at least one or two extra phone calls trying to figure out what "salad dressing on the side means" or "a scoop of ice-cream with the cake instead of cream" or "don't put hot water in the tea". You will then be delivered the wrong thing and the whole process starts again (this is after they try and charge you 20 USD EXTRA for a scoop of ice-cream of course). The food by the pool is even worse, you can only order sandwiches / burgers / bagels or fries. A sandwhich described as "filet de Beef mignon" turns out to be a sugar filled white processed bread filled with some of the frozen beef you find in supermarkets. When this is accompanied by fries cooked 2 hrs ago and an ocean of dressing on your two pieces of lettuce you start to feel a bit annoyed when you get a bill for 35 USD. This wouldn't be too bad if you could actually order something fresh or healthy from the room service menu if you are by the pool or at the bar. However a request to have grilled salmon was greeted with "no, this is the pool...you cannot have room service menu here". Really? Surely there is one kitchen and I believe this is a 5 star hotel? Same story trying to order a fresh juice cocktail at the bar area inside the hotel. Breakfast however is very good indeed.
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In any case we would recommend this hotel purely because of the location...but it's a real shame to have this amazing experience impacted by the feeling of being taken advantage of by Orient Express group.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but...

description: The hotel is located in a privileged position, alongside the Iguassu Falls. It is in fact the only hotel situated in the Iguassu National Park. Its colonial architecture is beautiful and its buildings are in complete harmony with the surrounding environment. The scenario is one of peace and tranquility. Because of its prime location, the Hotel das Cataratas offers its guests a unique experience - having breakfast whilst watching the falls and taking walks along the trails by the falls which may be done at any time during the day, with the added advantage that from 7 a.m to 9 a.m, the trails are for guests of the hotel exclusively.
